About.title: One team, one vision
About.lead: PKT was founded in 2016 and took part in its first competitions within the KartSport Circuit championship. In just a few years, driven by increasing demand and the growth of the project, the team evolved from an amateur spirit into a professional reality—starting with participation in the IAME X30 Italy championship and gradually expanding its commitments and the level of karting competitions it entered, achieving significant results along the way. In recent seasons, thanks to the passion of its founder, Stefano Matteuzzi, and the dedication and hard work of the team, PKT has structured itself to compete in multiple championships within a single season, in order to provide and guarantee a high-level service to its drivers. This has allowed us to broaden our know-how and establish ourselves as a team ready to take on new competitive challenges.Our goal is to grow and develop young drivers, helping them face national and international races with professionalism and discipline. We work in synergy to offer our clients professionalism, quality, efficiency, and elegance—supporting them as they pursue and achieve their dreams.

PrivacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.lead: This notice explains how we process personal data when you browse the website.

controller.title: 1. Data Controller
controller.body: The Data Controller is PKT Swiss Kart Team. For requests or information, please contact us via the email address shown in the website footer.

data.title: 2. Data we process
items: Browsing data (e.g., IP address, device/browser information, access date and time, pages visited).
Technical preferences (e.g., selected language), stored via cookies or local browser storage.
The website does not perform profiling and, unless otherwise stated, does not collect data through forms.

purposes.title: 3. Purposes and legal basis
items: To provide and operate the website and its features (necessary for service delivery / legitimate interest).
To store technical preferences (e.g., language) to improve the browsing experience (strictly necessary).

cookies.title: 4. Cookies and storage
cookies.body: We only use strictly necessary technical cookies/storage required for the website to function (for example, language preference). We do not use marketing or profiling cookies. You can manage or delete cookies and stored data in your browser settings.

thirdParties.title: 5. Third-party services
thirdParties.body: To display content (e.g., images/documents), the website may use technical third-party services (e.g., Google Drive and related services). These providers may receive technical browsing data (e.g., IP address) necessary to deliver the content.

recipients.title: 6. Recipients
recipients.body: Data may be processed by technical providers (e.g., hosting, CDN, Google services) acting as processors where applicable.

transfers.title: 7. International transfers
transfers.body: Some providers may process data outside the European Economic Area. Where applicable, transfers take place in accordance with relevant safeguards (e.g., Standard Contractual Clauses).

retention.title: 8. Retention
retention.body: Technical data is retained only as long as necessary to operate and secure the website. Preferences remain stored until you delete them.

rights.title: 9. Your rights
rights.body: You can exercise your GDPR rights (Articles 15–22: access, rectification, erasure, objection, restriction, portability) by contacting us using the details shown in the footer. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with your local data protection authority.
